title: Cannot fault this GP - It's fantastic
body: All of the staff are so friendly and helpful, and its easy to get through to reception at any time of day. (which in other practices I've found very difficult to do). They are genuine, and listen to your health problems, and act upon your concerns. Moving to this GP was the best decision I've ever made in terms of my healthcare.

title: Great Experience
body:
Got a telephone appt which I was very grateful for. The new GP (locum) who spoke with was lovely, very understanding, lots of empathy. Having discovered my GP has retired I was sad and a loss to the MHS. This surgery have been fantastic when I’ve needed them. 
On a second appt dealt I with the receptionist, who again was really helpful and understanding. 
I have recommended this GP surgery to people and they are now new patients having moved from a different area and have been impressed. 
Keep up the great work.

title: Very cooperative
body: All staff that I interacted with were very friendly and cooperative. This is what you need when you are I’ll and especially anxious.

title: Well done the staff at Wexham Park
body: I visited a friend in the revasculerisation part of A & E at Wexham Park Hospital. I was so impressed by the attention given by doctors and nurses. Not only were they clearly highly skilled, they were friendly, communicative and clearly very caring. Thank you.

title: Very freindly Receptionists!
body: A lot of people are very quick to judge and make negative comments about this surgery. I have been registered with this surgery for several years and hardly have ever had a bad experience. Doctors and nurses are lovely and very caring towards you. The girls at the main reception are the real angels of the surgery, always polite and freindly and they greet you with a big smile. I am a morning person so I mostly have appointments then. Not sure about the afternoon staff, but the girls here in the mornings are so lovely. Like a breath of fresh air

title: My practice for over 36 years
body: As with any other appointments I was treated with the utmost respect and care. My concerns were taken into account and the appropriate referral made. I have nothing but praise for The Fountain Medical Centre, every doctor I have seen over the years has been thorough, expert and most of all caring. I cannot recommend them highly enough. Thank you to all the staff and doctors at this practice for your outstanding work.

title: Great practice
body: I can never fault this surgery. Quick and easy to get appointment. Doctors have been seeing people face to face rather than using covid as an excuse not to. I've seen both the doctor and the nurse in the last month and both experiences were good. Doctors listen and act quickly. Nurses are caring and blood taken was pretty much painless which is a good sign they're doing it right! I know whatever I bring to the doctor's here it's taken seriously and not dismissed. One of the best practices I've joined. All that's missing is a pharmacy based in the surgery so your medication is there when you leave.

title: great practice
body: me and my family have been with your practice for 22years. The drs are always polite and so are the staff. Great idea to release all drs appointments on the day. carry on your great work

title: Fantastic Practice
body: I have been going here for 14 years now since pregnancy. The staff are excellent and have provided my family with good care. Recently I have had some medical issues and I have been well looked after. The female doctors and nurses are exceptional and the male doctors that are regular at the practice have also been great when I’ve seen them. Thanks for all you do

title: Incredible professional service
body: After having treatment at a Birmingham hospital,and gallbladder surgery not offered.l was admitted to Warwick hospital as an emergency. Treatment on Hatton ward was of the highest standard. And the ward manager should be congratulated on such a good team. A surgion reviewed my case and l was operated on the next day. I was very fortunate in being a patient at this excellent hospital.

title: Excellent service carried out by nurses
body: I attended day surgery yesterday to have my gallbladder removed & was so impressed by the care, patience & understanding from the nurses that looked after me. I am hard of hearing & had to have information repeated so many times! I felt unwell after my operation & was looked after so effectively with an antisickness injection & was observed constantly.  What a wonderful team you have! I am extremely grateful.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Appointment
body: Was booked in last minute by a dr, to be seen in person, who was very helpful over the phone and took me and my symptoms seriously. Went in to see a different doctor and I can’t stress how amazing this dr was. Even though my appointment was an hour late it was worth it for the kindness and helpfulness this dr had showed me. I wish I could thank her for all her help. Above and beyond. Ive been with this practice for almost my entire life and I can honestly say the drs I’ve seen are absolute gold.

title: Great team
body:
My 2 month old was taken sick and we were rushed to wexham by the GP. From the minute we were seen, even as my baby got worse I felt a sense of relief. The staff were amazing, everything that could be done was done as efficiently as possible. It happened to be a really busy night that we were admitted and our first full day on the ward was also really busy, the care we received was still brilliant and even though our case wasn't as serious as others we felt our baby was just as important.
Everyone I came across during our stay was lovely, from the housekeeping staff to the drs. Shift and staff changes were smooth and every member of staff seemed knowledgeable about our case showing good team work and communication. The ladies and gentlemen in the children's department, PAU and ward 24 are amazing!
I couldn't thank them enough, I have no doubt in my mind that if I ever needed them again I'd be full of confidence that my babies are in safe hands.

Thank you!

title: Positive
body: Waiting in the queue this morning the pro active nurse came out and asked if anyone was booked in for a blood test which I was. I went straight in and was on my way home again in under five minutes. Therefore for me today personally it was a very good experience.

title: Very prompt and thorough
body: I am on holiday and an injury I sustained at home a fortnight ago was troubling me.  Boots Pharmacy in Bakewell suggested I attend the Whitworth UTC.  I am very grateful to the pharmacist in Boots and to the very kind, efficient triage nurse who checked me over and gave me a prescription.  I am now able to enjoy the remainder of my holiday with peace of mind, so thank you very much.  I must add that the UTC receptionist was really welcoming and friendly too.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing care
body: I came to A&E this morning (30.06.22) after calling 111 with back and abdomen pain, I was seen so quickly by people in A&E and in urgent care and every single person i came across, nurses, doctors the reception staff everyone was absolutely lovely, so professional and so so helpful! Especially the people I seen in the SDEC department, I can’t thank them all enough!

title: Doctors are great, reception staff are not!
body:
I have been registered at this practice for years, and I can't say I've ever had a pleasant interaction with the receptionists. It has gotten to the point where I'm afraid to call because I am worried they will be nasty, condescending, or rude. I have even cried after coming off the phone with them before. Occasionally you can make it through booking an appointment without being left feeling like you were just told off/talked down to, but I wouldn't describe those experiences as 'pleasant'.
Once I was asked brusquely why I was making an appointment so soon after being seen, and asked "is it *actually* important". When I explained I had been told to follow up by the doctor, there was a long sigh as if I was a major inconvenience, and then: 'Fine! What's your date of birth?!'
After getting fed-up of 5min. pointless phone calls, I asked if there was any way to see a doctor in person. I was told to explain why, and then: "No you can't make an appointment for that, just speak to my colleague", and was promptly transferred to someone (no idea who) to explain my issue. I didn't know a receptionist could say no to making an appointment when I had a clear medical reason. Maybe if they had explained what the problem with my request was, or was more patient in the way they spoke, I wouldn't have felt so put-out.
I can't put my finger on what the exact issue is, just that as a medical receptionist I imagine you should not make sick/vulnerable/potentially anxious people feel belittled or ashamed to call their healthcare provider. But both I and my flatmate, who is also registered here, feel this way whenever we speak to the reception team. You are also made to feel like you've inconvenienced them/asked them the biggest favour, when simply booking an appointment.
I understand that the NHS is under stress, and it must be a demanding job, but as it is a customer service role I think basic people skills should be a given.
The doctors, when you can see them, are great and professional. The main nurse is lovely. I just wish the front-of-house team didn't make me dread dealing with my GP.

title: Best help ever
body:
Treatment and staff excellent 
Everything they did for me worked they mended a broken man 
Can't fault this practice

title: Excellent care.
body: It's very distressing to read so many negative comments about Manor Farm on a local chat website. My Sister and I have been patients here for 11 years and have always received excellent and caring service from many different members of the team during that time. This is particularly true of the last few years when both Covid and staff shortages have made life doubly difficult for the practice. They have dealt with it admirably, and continue to do so. It's particularly saddening and unjustified that one doctor was even described as "infamous"; when he always gave unstintingly of his time and skill. We seem to live in a very angry world these days and I  hope this review will go some way towards redressing the balance.

title: health care at Weaver vale practice.  What's…
body: After contracting covid pneumonia in april2022 and the diagnosed long covid problems I am having I have had to attend this practice for the 1st time in 2 years.  I am appalled at the long wait for appointments, no continuity of care from GPs, "jobs worth" receptionists, rushed 10min GP consultations dealing with 1 problem only, delay in notifying you of test results, being passed from one locum GP to another who you have had no therapeutic relationship with etc etc.  This is not the Weaver vale practice that I have known in the past 40 years I have been with them.  I am shocked to feel that they are doing you a favor in seeing you and they are too tired and overwhelmed to care. What a shame for a once very good practice

title: Fantastic experience
body: Would like to commend the efficiency and outstanding care in paediatric ED. From entrance to exit in just 40 minutes with triage, X-ray, review and plaster cast in between. Could not wish for better care for my son.

title: If only we knew what was going on!
body: Seriously very sad that relatives of loved ones trying to find out information can be ignored by phones not being answered. It’s simply bad management and planning. We do need to know.

title: Been diagnosed  wrong more than a few occasions
body:
In the past I was told by a GP I had rabbies..  after weeks of medication and medicating my whole family along side washing ever fibre in my home and destroying a very expensive rug.. and still no cure, so went back to the GP and was told by another GP that I had eczema!

Again a week ago I went in with belly aches and a protruding belly, was told by the GP it will settle and was sent away! Only for the pains to continue, went to A&E on the advice of a nurse at work, I was told by the doctor at A&E that I needed movical to help movement with my stool as the painkillers could of caused this a blockage. 

You can never get an appointment or a telephone consultation as they are always fully booked. To speak to reception is a minimum 1 hour wait. 

This surgery was the best before.. now its absolutely awful, no regards for their patience health or mental wellbeing. 

If you love yourself or your family avoid like the plague as they will not help you.

title: Gardening for mindfulness
body: Nice place to be... in the summer weather, Get a few plants to take home and water, however, I've never been fortunate with any plants. They die eventually! Nice to share a cup of tea, coffee, biscuits with other neighbours/patients when there. When it's open that is. The person who runs the gardening group has very little experience with people who suffer with mental health issues. Would recommend the gardening group appoints a specialist in such a field. Other than that, it's not too bad. There is scope for big improvements. Enjoy when you go.

title: Excellent compassion
body: I telephoned the surgery this morning (30.6.22) to a very understanding member of staff. To then be treated by a brilliant doctor whose care and explanation were exemplary. I would like to take take this opportunity to thank you all.

title: Nightmare
body: Getting appointments are impossible, you call at 8am and if you are luck to go through, you will be caller no 90,call at non peak times you Still can't get through straightaway.You email them ,never a response. You need their assistance, never there to help and support. I have cried,pleased ,explained tons of times while I really need their help and for it to be answered urgently, but this practice simply don't do well with urgently administrative matters which is soo not nice.up on till now(01-06-2022)I'm still yet to get a response from them regarding my request. Honestly, I feel shattered...

title: Caring Staff
body: Every stage was closely monitored by the caring staff. Nothing was any trouble for them. The building was very clean and staff efficient. I would certainly recommend and will be returning for my second eye operation with confidence.

title: Extremely good practice
body: This practice are doing their best under extremely difficult circumstances. Personally speaking I find being polite even when you can’t get what you want helps . I have received excellent service from Blackthorn GP’s, Nurses & in particular support staff.

title: Good advice
body:
Seen on time staff very helpful and very good and extremmely patient with clients.
It seems nothing is too much trouble for them.

title: Communication
body:
With any other method of communicating with the surgery disabled, I telephoned at one minute after the opening time of 8am. The message said I was number 17 in the queue to be answered. Seventeen other people beat me in that minute. If I wait until 8.30 to call, I am told that there are no more appointments today - please try tomorrow.
There must be better methods of getting a service. I am not allowed to make an appointment in the future so how do I proceed?

title: Great practice
body: They have always been very helpful & nice,friendly & very considred,I will always recommend this surgery to anybody that wishes to come to this docters

author: Boots1968
title: Fabulous team on ward 1B
body: Just wanted to say what fabulous care I received from all the team at ward 1B, the appointment was very prompt and the lovely lady (sorry I can’t recall her name) went through everything with me and most importantly listened to how I was feeling. I had to have a biopsy while I was there and the ladies assisting made me feel comfortable and relaxed which I really appreciated. I had a clear understanding of what would happen next which was very different from my recent experience with my local GP! Well done to all the team on 1B you are a shining example of what patient care should be like x

title: Great doctor
body: I didn’t know where else to write this but I felt the need to give feedback of the gp who was a locum gp at this surgery that I visited recently. She was absolutely lovely, efficient yet covered everything I needed. She was empathetic and understanding. Explained everything fully with me. I felt listened to and was given all the time I needed with her. I can’t put into words what it meant to me to have her take the time to explain my symptoms properly. I know that everyone is feeling burnt out in the nhs but this gp did not give off this vibe. I want to name her so she gets the recognition she deserves but I know we are not allowed to write names.

title: Wonderful practice with fantastic staff
body: I am thankful every day that this is our surgery. Every single member of staff from reception, pharmacy and through to the clinical staff are fantastic. All very helpful and friendly. I've always felt listened to and validated during appointments with clinical staff. Their knowledge and ability always excellent and I trust them implicitly. The reception staff go out of their way to provide an excellent first point of contact and the dispensary staff are extremely helpful too.

title: Bad reception attitude
body:
I explained parking issue was told you have gone over 15mins so I'm sorry the physio can't see you he has another client even though I had a 30 minute slot ? Only used 15 minutes up 
. Considering fuel 40 minute drive parking issues the receptionist needs to be more understanding she told me I will email him see if he can fit you in oh sorry he can't!!!..

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Useless
body: Rang at 8 was number one in que thought oh brilliant hour and 10 minutes later still on the phone at que position number one ! Appalling for a gp surgery

title: Great staff but rather basic for a private…
body: The staff, nurses, and consultants are amazing and go out of there way to help. The facilities though are rather basic compared to other private providers. Day care users just get a basic cubicle the same as in an NHS casualty area. Staff also seem to be reduced, there’s no real reception at the day care unit. You just have to hope somebody answers the bell.

author: robinpk45
title: I didn't foresee the care and time that was afforded to me
body: I have never had to stay overnight in a hospital setting and I was nervous as well as feeling really unwell. The nursing staff were amazing whilst I was being treated in the C.A.D. I was then moved to ward 3E, again I was very nervous and unsure about my surroundings. I didn't need to be nervous as the nursing staff were so lovely and also explaining everything that was happening. All nurses and assistants were amazing helping me to the toilet and assisting in shower. I then moved to a different room where Joanne looked after all four of us throughout the day who were in the ward. The nursing assistants also couldn't be more helpful with personal hygiene and providing lots of lovely mugs of tea! (Thank you). I honestly didn't foresee the care and time that was afforded to me and I will always be grateful. The staff are so understaffed and still manage to give a five star service (5/5) :)

author: tucanadp54
title: Gap in care when dealing with miscarriages
body:
I found out I was pregnant about 4 weeks ago. After my sister had a miscarriage the year before I knew that North Lanarkshire midwives would not see patients before 8 weeks gestation as most miscarriages happen before this time. I therefore decided to book a private scan. The scan was done in early June, the pregnancy sac could be seen however there was no fetal pole or yolk sac, I was past the 7 weeks mark and I was certain of my dates. I was advised to contact the Early Pregnancy Unit for advice.  
I contacted the EPU at Wishaw 2 days later, I made 63 calls, they either rang out or the line was engaged. There was no facility to leave a voicemail. I contacted Coatbridge Health Centre and spoke with a midwife who was really good and advised that as I had no pain or bleeding I wouldn't be seen at the EPU.  
The next day I had slight bleeding and tried again to contact the EPU, I made 50 calls and still couldn't get through. I started work in the afternoon so my sister offered to call for me, she made 36 calls and also could not get through.  
The next day the pain increased and I started to bleed more heavily. I contacted the Coatbridge midwives as I still couldn't get through to the EPU. I spoke to a Midwife who offered to contact them for me, they called me back and an appointment was arranged for the following afternoon. Unfortunately that night I miscarried.  
The next day I still couldn't get through to the EPU so decided to call Coatbridge midwives. I spoke to a midwife and advised of what had happened and asked if I was still required to have a full bladder for the scan. They advised I should still attend with a full bladder. There was no compassion regarding my miscarriage and I felt dismissed as if what happened was not their concern.  
I attended my appointment and after a very uncomfortable transvaginal scan it was revealed I had miscarried however there appeared to still be some tissue still to pass. They took some blood to check my HCG levels and they advised they would contact me the same day with the results. My results revealed that my HCG levels were still high and I was advised to return within 48 hours to have them repeated.  
The EPU only runs from Mon-Fri 7am-4pm therefore I would need to attend triage to have the blood work done. The other option was to take another pregnancy test within a fortnight to check my HCG levels. I found this option dismissive and after what had happened I really didn't want to take another pregnancy test.  
I attended triage 48 hours later, whilst taking my bloods I was asked what it was for. It was an extremely upsetting to explain why I was there. I asked if the results would be passed to me that day and I was advised that was the EPU responsibility and they would contact me the following day.  
The next day I was contacted by the EPU. They asked if triage had already passed my results and I informed them that I hadn't and was advised it was the responsibility of the EPU. I was then told that triage can pass the results however choose not to. My results indicated that my miscarriage was complete and my HCG levels were now at 10 and if I did another pregnancy test the results should come back negative.  
I asked about after care and basically what happens now. I was given information regarding when my cycle should return to normal and my case was closed at their end. Again I asked what happens now. I found the experience traumatic, upsetting and physically painful and I thought as common practice I would be passed onto services that would help me deal with my loss. The member of staff from the EPU seemed flustered and put me on hold as they went to find a website address for me. After several minutes I was given the address of a website and advised that my care is now closed at their end.  
There is obviously a gap in care when dealing with miscarriages and I felt no one took responsibility for my care after my pregnancy loss. I feel in limbo with this expectation that I should just return to normal, as if it shouldn't matter. This pregnancy mattered to me and feel extremely let down by the care I have received. I know there has been a pandemic however I feel this has been used as a crutch to justify bad service.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Where are the promised improvements to…
body:
In April the new Practice Business Manager posted that they were reviewing patient access "as a matter of urgency" and that "you will see an improvement in our access over the coming months"
Two months on and nothing has changed. I have been trying to get an appointment for 2 weeks now!!!

title: Poor practice
body: Hospital lost my paperwork at one point , then a week before surgery due date had it cancelled without proper explanation over the phone and was passed on to another hospital to start all over again , really feel let down by Oaklands Hospital .

title: Pointless
body:
Firstly you can’t get threw to anyone on the phone, When you do it’s the same thing I get told everytime.
Either call back first thing in the morning which is pointless because you can’t get threw or the appointments are all gone or I get told the appointments available are months away and you can’t even book them yet because the diary hasn’t been done yet! So basically I’m signed Upto a doctors surgery I can’t use.
I’ve been putting off calling because it’s just so frustrating to get told the same thing over and over so I can just hope the health concerns I have don’t end up being something serious as I’ve tried to attempt to get some advice and help and constantly No help!

title: Improvement
body: I feel that since my last review it's been easier to get telephone appointments towards the end of the week .The doctors are doing a great job and they are Compassionate and listen to you and do not rush you during your consultation. Issues discussed are followed through. A shout out to the receptionist who was really helpful when I rang on 30th June and tried her best to get me an appointment with a nurse she was lovely. The receptionists are always polite and helpful.

title: A shambles
body: You cannot get through to this surgery, they shut down the online triage form and it takes hours to get through on the phone.  Staff are clearly stressed and it would appear they only have 2 GPS working! No wonder A&E in Plymouth is overflowing because no one can get an adequate service from this surgery. Deeply concerning.

title: Cant get an appointment
body: Called this morning for appointment was offered one at 3 o'clock I advised the receptionist I was unable to make that time due to working. The next pre bookable appointment was September 6th. I was advised by the receptionist that I could call each morning at 8am for an appointment. I explained to the receptionist that I work most weekdays and am not able to sit on the phone for an appointment. I was advised that this is the best they could offer. Very poor service for members of the public that work.

title: e-services do not work
body:
Contact GP on line takes me through a different surgery all together from mobile and 3 browsers. I have raised this with them that I am unable to leave an email to the GP practice.
Then on the phone, they are now booking only until 11 o clock. I have called 4 times since 9 o clock. It is now 10:30. Option number 5 does not work. Option 1 keeps me on hold and after being "caller number 4 or 3 in the queue" it went to ringing and then rang for at least 10 minutes until I quit and called again as clearly it is ringing somewhere else. I have had to call 4 times and doing that at work. it is impossible to get through to them unless you go there any more.

title: Telephone practice by receptionist
body: Unfortunately, I feel I have to write this review due to a very curt receptionist who dealt with my enquiry regarding a referral to a consultant, as recommended by the doctor I saw 5 days ago. My health has deteriorated which is why I'm being referred. I was told that I'm 'on the list' and more urgent cases being dealt with. I asked to speak to the secretary but was told I couldn't. I felt like there was no way I could move this referral forward. I'm deeply dissatisfied by such a lack of understanding and being shut down by the phone being put down on me.

title: Not great service
body: Tried on numerous occasions for advice about how long waiting list for foot and ankle just told me to call to be put on cancellation list so I called and left a message but no one has called back in alot of pain but don’t seem to care at all even though I said I will have to go private which I can’t afford,why paying NI ? Staff at reception don’t care as they want to get you off the phone asap!!!

title: Caring practice
body: Doctors go out of their way to help and reassure patients even making a home visit after practice hours to help a frightened and worried patient waiting for heart surgery. If I need them I know they will do all they can to sort things out for me

title: Reception
body: When you actually are given a doctors appointment the Doctors are generally very good . The problem is the Receptionists. They are generally extremely dismissive and rude. Talking over you in an aggressive manor. When you attempt to complain it just falls on deaf ears. There is no need to be rude or obstructive. I very rarely visit the doctors because I find the whole process exhausting. They say treat people how you expect to be treated well I think the Reception team need to do the same. How many awful reviews doe is take for Ashfield to realise there is a big problem here???!!!

author: lynxbs89
title: They have also made me smile and become more confident
body: A huge Thank you to Julie physiotherapist and Andy from the community physiotherapy team (physical disability) southern trust Armagh . At a time when it was so difficult during the covid pandemic. These two absolute angels have been coming in to my home on a weekly basis. Their professionalism, compassion, care and understanding has gone beyond the boundaries of "their daily brief". There have been many difficult days, tears (mine!), But they have also made me smile and become more confident and determined. Thanks to them I have found a "new me" and have reached a level of mobility that in some dark days I would not have thought possible. I am so very grateful.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent practice and treatment.
body:
The experience was very good. The doctor very clearly explained the problem and gave solutions. He checked perfectly for any problems. Was very nice. 
Would definitely recommend the doctor for anyone with similar issues. 

The receptionist however, were awful. It made us uncomfortable when they laughed at a patient, a lot, because of a misunderstanding instead of trying to help them. I personally felt very, very uncomfortable and embarrassed for the patient who kept trying to talk to them but they just laughed and told him that whoever told him to go there was a ‘stupid doctor’.

author: AL21
title: Paediatrician at Causeway Hospital made me feel assured
body:
My twins are under the care of Dr Ledwith due to them being premature, I just want to mention the great patient care & assuring nature of Dr Ledwith.  
I am a first time mum & he made me feel very assured and it’s great being able to reach out to him if need be for peace of mind if any issues would arise between appointments.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great Practice
body: Extremely helpful staff always ready to help nothing is too much. I couldn't have got through such a difficult illness and still ongoing with my husband. The office manager and Doctors have been so supportive and i can't thank them enough for listening and prompt responses. Thank you.

title: Amazing facility
body: This was my 2nd time as an inpatient at Barlborough for knee replacement surgery and in my opinion you couldn't have this surgery at a better place.  It is truly outstanding. The facilities are excellent but it really is the staff that makes this hospital so superb.  They are professional, kind, and friendly and that is EVERY member of the staff at whatever level.  They really are a credit to their profession and I cannot thank them enough

title: Can't get any help 111 option 2 ( FRS)
body: This service is disappointing to put it nicely. I have been batteling with some very difficult things going on in my life currently. To the point that I feel intensely suicidal. I've been calling FRS for the last 3 days now and it's difficult to even get through. To the point I am on hold for about an hour until the phone cuts out and drops the call and then I have to call again. The last 2 months I have been In crisis, now every time I call the tell me that I have a frequent caller plan. I have no Idea what it is but it's stopping me from getting any further support I.E seeing the home treatment team or even a hospital admission. They won't even let me speak to a clinical physiatrist. Plus me apparently having bpd is also not helping me get any further support as they see me just having a crisis for attention. I'm am honestly destroyed by this service for not even considering my needs as a person rather than a diagnosis. The mental health system has got even worse since FRS have been around the only decent thing they do is the sanctuary that is the one thing they are doing right.

readBy.name: Cambridgeshire And Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely Experience
body: I don't normally attend the surgery but was very impressed when I had to contact the surgery.  Although it was very busy when I rang when I did get through the staff were very helpful and directed me to the best person to help with my problem.  Thank you for working through the hardest of circumstances and still having smiles on your faces.

title: Excellent care. Wonderful staff.
body: I have always found the staff at Trevelyan House to be kind and considerate. But during my visit today then went above and beyond. They were very reactive and helpful and everything was sorted very quickly. I could not recommend them enough.

title: Outstanding Service
body:
Lightwater Surgery is one of the best practice I have experienced. I have to admit staff in every single department is so professional and friendly. They go extra mile to support your needs. Since last 1 year I have had to visit the surgery 2-3 times a month on an average (if not more). I have 3 elderly registered with them and my family. There service every single time was excellent with the best smile on there face. 
Thank you so much to every single one of you in the Surgery.  You are doing amazing job. 

Fatima (Vanya Cottage)

title: Helpful staff
body: Even if I couldn’t see the doctor I got to see a practitioner nurse who was very helpful and friendly

author: velanz68
title: Waiting times in an emergency
body: I have spent 7 hours in the emergency department waiting to have a response for my pain and bleeding. Too much time for an emergency.

author: Keylimepie77
title: Getting a mole removed
body: I was very nervous and frightened but the staff put me at ease from the beginning. Kirsty, Alisha and student Jacqueline were very kind,  helpful and knowledgeable. The op was done quickly and very efficiently, Kirsty talked me through every step of the way ,including after treatment. I'm nervous about needles but Kirsty used a small one and was very gentle..she made sure the anaesthetic made the area was completely numb before she began the op .It was painless ..just a pulling sensation when the stitches were being done .It was all over quickly and I felt informed and safe the whole time .Many thanks to all the staff ..you all do a wonderful job ! .

readBy.name: MASScot- Melanoma Action and Support Scotland

author: JoyfulWI
title: Expressing gratitude for staff members at Spring Hill Practice
body:
I have been a patient of the practice for many many years. I thought I would take this opportunity to express my gratitude towards them, from the reception , to the nurses (Shiraz), to the Secretary and last but not least especially my GP, Dr Kiela who works incredibly hard to help towards my health.  
This practise is awesome in their care and approach and I would whole heartedly recommend their service . 10/10

author: Emil22
title: I feel good and more confident
body:
It was a pleasure to meet Natasha. I had to decrease my anxiety and times of depression. For this, Natasha was super professional helping me to resolve these two problems. She is very kind and always there to help. I really appreciate her help and advice. Now, I can say that I feel good and more confident. Thank you a lot for your help!  
[Unsure about 'Appointments']

author: ophiuchustq77
title: Speech and language therapy
body: My partner was referred for speech and language. He has busbar paulsy. The Speech and language therapist contacted him and said they would visit him in our home. On the day, they didn't turn up so I called and was told they were off due to sickness, I complained that nobody had contacted us to let us know.... I asked to be contacted as soon as they got back but heard nothing, I emailed and asked for contact to rearrange, I am still waiting, it's been almost two weeks.... meanwhile he has his appointment for his pre-op for a brain tumour and we were hoping to discuss many things with the SLT as he may need a PEG .... this is worrying and frustrating,

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: hawkcd65
title: Professional but warm and understanding
body: My appointment with Catherine was so refreshing. She was professional but warm and understanding. Explained everything fully and calmed any reservations I may have had about my cataract surgery. She was on time and efficient, the NHS is going through a tough time and as an employee with a GP surgery I understand the stress. Catherine was a breath of fresh air and a real asset.

author: JBaran
title: Psychotherapy sessions made me more positive
body: I had a number of sessions with Josephine who was a great listener and helper. She is professional and has a wide range of interests in the field of psychology. She works on specific targets and suggests different approaches. Thanks to her I feel a lot stronger when my abusive ex-partner tries to bully me. I am also more aware of my feelings and what causes them. I realise that this will be continuous hard work in my life but now I have more tools to face the challenges.

readBy.name: South West London and St George's Mental Health NHS Trust

author: vickers78
title: Diagnosis of a medical condition
body: Vital to get correct diagnosis of medical condition. Spent two years paying for dermatology treatment, only when referred to vascular consultant was my condition correctly diagnosed and treated by NHS

author: swingjt35
title: Super duper service
body: Super duper service my drug worker is amazing isn't just a drug worker also a counsellor and get on really well.

author: sleepy Joe
title: Got told on arrival that unfortunately surgery needs to be rebooked
body:
I suffer from sleep apnoea, was referred for surgery over 2 years ago, finally got some good news mid June 22 from Antrim area booking office that I could be offered a slot for the procedure to be done. Procedure was booked in after calling Antrim booking office was told the date was booked for end of June 22. When I asked the exact procedure and if any other steps are required was told not their department they are bookings only and that I need to contact the secretary of the consulting doctor.  
Followed their instructions attempted to call the secretary after a very long wait on hold put through to secretary line only to hear a voicemail stating unfortunately secretary for my doctor in ENT is off until the following week. Called ENT again to speak to a different secretary but they advised that only the doctor's secretary could discuss my procedure details upon this I asked if the doctor could call me to discuss this further I was told unfortunately my specific doctor does not work on Fridays and I would need to call back at a later date.  
During this I notified my management of the procedure as I was unsure of the amount if time I would require and coming up to June/July getting time off is not an easy thing to do and trying to survive on sick pay would be a challenge. I had to swap shifts and get only one day off approved to cover me for a few days off as I still didn't know the ins and outs of the procedure or recovery time.  
I called back on the day when the secretary was due back in, it was after 2pm and was told unfortunately that the secretary had finished for the day but they would leave a message for them and asked if they could call me on the following Monday. 3 day before my surgery date as I needed information on what was happening. I also advised them I would he working this day but to leave me a voicemail and I would get back to them asap. No call happened, I chased this up the next day and once again the secretary was not in but one of the other secretaries in the ENT was able to give me general info based on the letter I was provided, they said based on the letter I would be on local anaesthetic and recovery could span from 2-14 days and that full recovery would be approximately a month based on this info my management were able to help and book paid time off and very short notice.  
Today the day of my surgery at mid ulster hospital day surgery I have been informed that due to my health conditions that local anaesthetic is not a safe option and that no surgery can be done until a preassessment has been conducted and that the preassessment as well as the surgery will need to be conducted at a different hospital (antrim).  
The staff at mid ulster have been extremely kind and helpful and apologised that no date for a surgery should be given without a preassessment being completed first and that unfortunately no surgery would be happening today, and that they would be investigating this matter as it is not the first time it has happened. After 2 years I have been advised I will be notified in the future of another possible date.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: skyec44
title: I would like to thank all concerned
body:
I cannot fault any part of my treatment. I have really been looked after, for which I'm truly grateful and would like to thank all concerned.  
Poem to tell my story.  
As I celebrate my birthday and the 77 years I've seen I wallow in memories of the good that's been I've toured the world, cruised the seas even done a sky dive, climbed hills and mountains, walked a mile, felt good to be alive  
Then came that day last august when I stumbled and suffered a stroke Paralyzed down my right side unable to move/speak was no joke I said "goodbye" to my happy life as the future looked so bleak 7 weeks in hospital, after 2, I managed to speak I really wanted to end it all but then I thought of you My wonderful family with all your support, I hoped you'd pull me through  
Now here I am after 9 months, mobile and verbal, no less Having just got back from the USA where I wore my pretty dress to the wedding of my first born - my aim set and achieved  
Who'd have thought 9 months ago my goal would be believed? You've all been truly wonderful with your help and support picking me up whenever, without a second thought If not for you my dear, special friends, I don't know what I'd do But I know your care and endless love gives me strength to pull through.  
May 2022

title: Very helpful
body: My mum was given an emergency appointment.  Every effort was made to do all the tests required at the same visit without having to return and this was achieved.  All staff were very pleasant and helpful.

author: errandpm94
title: Gave me something to live for
body:
3 weeks ago I attended dermatology clinic, Lagon Valley hospital (Lisburn). I am receiving treatment of U.V. light 3 times per week. No long waiting times, staff are so helpful and caring. When I first attended, I was in the depths of despair but when one of the nurses (Karyne) talked me through the procedure and treatments available it gave me something to live for. It was good to know someone cared. I give the clinic and the staff 10/10.  
Thank you so much.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Friendly staff
body: Friendly and helpful reception and the lovely Drs/Nurses I've met are so kind, empathetic, friendly and supportive. Never had a bad experience from the surgery in the last 11years! Thank you guys!

title: Amazing Staff
body: I attended on a very busy evening coinciding with many arrival from Glastonbury Festival. As expected there were delays due to numbers but the attention was faultless and so thorough.

title: Efficiency and warmth
body: I have been as a new patient several times. I found people on the phone , reception and doctors efficient , patient , good listening skills and thorough . I have been able to get face to face appointments and not had to wait long. All such a relief after stress of Covid restrictions for past few years.

title: Attention to detail during the pathway to…
body:
Recommended to me that QA had the best Prostate cancer programme in the South including private!
So far awaiting my Brachytherapy Op.

title: High Wycombe minor injuries. (UTC)
body:
I was advised by my GP to visit minor injuries. 

When we initially went in the receptionist was really friendly and I was seen quickly then advised to go and come back a few hours later for an appointment- better than sitting waiting in an reception area for 4 hours! 

When we came back for the appointment a different receptionist spoke to us and was incredibly rude. But I was seen relatively close to my appointment time and the nurse I saw for treatment was absolutely brilliant, I couldn’t fault her- her bedside manner was great and she did a wonderful job of distracting me while she had to do some treatment that was quite painful. 

Overall I would recommend it, as I said the nurse was wonderful- just expect there to be a chance that the receptionist will be very rude. Not exactly unheard of for NHS receptionists..

author: footballfh49
title: Helped me make changes
body: The support I've got from Inclusion is 2nd to none, they helped me make changes that I couldn't do on my own, they didn't judge me when I stumbled, just showed me how to get back up and look forward. Looking forward to trying acupuncture.

title: Outstanding
body:
I took my husband Peter to SpaMedica in Romford for his first cataract surgery and can honestly say that everything was so organised, clean and professional from start to finish.
We were greeted by Paul who made him feel so at ease. All the staff are truly wonderful and so professional. The surgery itself was over in such a short time and everyone concerned treated him with great kindness. Thank you all for the positive experience.

title: Incredibly helpful
body: I have always found the receptionists and admin staff to be very helpful.  This morning I spoke to a receptionist who was just lovely. Unfortunately I am not permitted to name her. I was confused about a prescription and she was patient, helpful, funny and gave me clear instructions for sorting this out.  She made my day!

author: tigerzz76
title: A well conducted class for exercises
body:
1) A well conducted class for exercises  
2) No time wasted from arrival to departure  
3) Class improved my posture even though I have some back ache  
4) Had difficult remembering some of the experiences, the table had about 3 or 4 exercise cards. The other exercise cards would be useful to prompt me.  
5) Not often a full class - could a way manage a couple more places.

title: Got treatment I needed.
body: I needed a blood form so that I could have a blood test at local hospital, a location that suited me. The surgery were able to provide this promptly  for me to collect which was very helpful.

author: saturngt36
title: A wonderful team of physiotherapists and nurses
body: A wonderful team of physiotherapists and nurses. Very kind and caring and patient. Learnt a lot about my condition and how to improve it and deal with it. Felt very cared for throughout. Shall miss them all.

title: Exceptional
body: Recently my family have needed medical support from the surgery. I can not  recommend the practice enough. In a time when reassurance, support and professionalism was needed we felt completely support. Communication was key and every member of staff went over and above to meet both our medical and emotional needs.

author: HeidiS
title: Really positive experience of maternity scan
body:
I just wanted to write a message to compliment Nick and Peter who performed my 32 week scan. The scan was because I had pre-eclampsia during my first labour with my first daughter.  
With this being my second baby but 5th pregnancy I’ve had quite a few scans, private and through the NHS. But I just felt that Nick and Peter today were amazing. They were friendly and informative and just made the whole experience really positive.  
Massive thank you to them both.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Care of my parents
body:
We are so privileged that our parents are under the care of Meadow View surgery.

Narinder the health care professional is incredible. Not only has she taken great care of my parents’ health, but also she is lovely to speak with at every appointment. It’s rare to find a health care professional that combines such personal touches and care for a patient with outstanding quality of medical care. I highly recommend becoming her patient.

The two receptionists I come across the most are Doris and Hema, they are both so pleasant, patient and accommodating while being very attentive to the demands of their important job. They are the indispensable  link to the vital services provided by Meadow View Surgery on which my parents depend. 

As my parents are getting older it’s very  reassuring and comforting to know that Meadow View surgery is looking after them so well.

author: ariel
title: Experience at the breast clinic
body:
Spent an hour and a half travelling to Ninewells for a breast ultrasound. I was referred by my GP.  
My appointment was for 9:55am but wasn't taken until 11:25 am approx. I was unaware that I would see a doctor and because my mammogram was fine they wanted to leave it at that. I thought it was best to have an ultrasound so waited way over my appointment time.  
The ultrasound was very quick and only did one side of the breast by a trainee. Must admit there didn't seem to be a lot of "care" there. Not a pleasant experience.  
As per usual, the nurses and other staff were lovely.

author: paprikape36
title: Wart removal
body:
Had another wart appear.  
Staff were extremely professional and polite. Made me feel very calm and relaxed.

author: EvieRuby
title: We were all instant friends
body:
I am a very bubbly loving 10yr old girl but I suffer from dyslexia and anxiety. I struggle sometimes being in new situations and can get very scared and angry if I don’t know what’s happening or if I have to undergo a new treatment I have never had before.  
I recently had a bowel impaction sorted at hospital and I was really nervous. I refused the treatments because I was so scared by what the doctors were saying & I couldn’t understand.  
My dad was there to help me and Sarah from the Archie Foundation at the Royal Aberdeen Children's hospital really helped me through it. Not only did she distract me with lots of fun activities, she helped me & my dad when I was angry/upset and didn’t want to go to surgery. We played lots of games all week and had the best time. It helped relax me and I felt safe with my dad and Sarah looking after me. Sarah and the team made me so welcome and we were all instant friends, we made friends with other patients too.  
I don’t think the children's hospital would run anywhere near as well without Sarah and the play team. It helps us all stay calm and makes hospital visits less terrifying. We had such fun during a really stressful period that I’d love to go back and visit. It’s difficult to express how much Sarah and the Archie Foundation at Aberdeen helped us.  
Dad got to rest for a bit when Sarah was teaching me fun new things in the play area, which he needed as it was hard being in hospital for a week worrying about me. I don’t think we could ever thank Sarah, the play team or the Archie Foundation enough, we wouldn’t have got through it without you all.

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West

author: RobinG
title: I couldn't ask for better care
body: I had an appointment in urology on Monday morning. For a cystoscopy and as there have been some ongoing problems for me with getting a catheter inserted I was a bit anxious to say the least. However the staff there were so helpful & friendly and put me at ease right away. The consultant Mr Cox was really great. It was quite difficult for him due to a constriction that has been causing problems. I really appreciated his persistence and care. He gave some very wise advice (against) on possibly going private and I really appreciated his wisdom and caution on that route. I really felt for him as it was a bit of a struggle but I am thankful for his skill. After wards he took the time to explain everything and what they plan next. He has put me on the urgent list- and down to accept a cancellation and I believe he is doing all within his means to get the problems sorted. So I want to say a BIG thank you to all the team there. I couldn't have asked for better care

title: Excellant service and care
body:
Visited Salters for my daughter as she suffers from reoccurring ear infections. Got a face to face appointment that exact day with an ANP. My daughter was examined and given antibiotics and made a full recovery!
Never had any issues with this practice, they have always given my family a 5 star service

title: Outstanding care
body: My experience with QMC has been incredible and the staff at A23 inpatient and outpatient is truly incredible. The kind and caring nature that every single member of staff showed me was amazing at such an incredibly difficult time. I can’t thank all the nurses, doctors,trainee nurses, everyone enough. A thank you will never be enough.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

author: cafery77
title: An awful experience
body:
I was induced for labour in May 2021 at the Queen Elizabeth hospital in Glasgow. During my induction I had great staff and have only positives to say about the experience.  
I later moved down to the labour ward where I met the midwife and a student midwife who would be there for the birth. The midwife couldn't have been less interested in anything I had to say and this process continued throughout my entire labour. They administered hormone treatment without my consent even though I was already at 8cm and progressing well on my own without it. I started over contracting and had severe pain in my back and I vocalised this several times but they refused to check me even though my labour had been moving quickly.  
I felt the urge to push and they still didn't check me. Other members of staff, the student midwife, the person who gave me my epidural stated that they felt I should be checked but they insisted I wasn't to be checked for another 2 hours.  
After an hour the baby's heart rare plummeted and they came to check me, only to run back out seconds later when a doctor rushed in and told me we needed to get baby out quickly. After going to my 8 week check my doctor told me this was because baby got stuck the wrong way round in the birth canal which obviously couldn't have been avoided but was a traumatic situation for me and the baby. All the emergency staff running in probably could have been less if they had just listened to me when I said what was going on. Or I could have been offered a c section and wouldn't have all the trauma of feeling the doctor turn my baby vaginally  
Furthermore I hemorrhaged and was told that I didn't lose that much blood. However a doctor came down 3 days later to recovery to tell me that I was at transfusion level and they couldn't tell me what it was at the day of birth when my heart rate was through the roof. I got an apology.  
I then asked to be discharged as the care I was receiving in recovery was also very very poor from very rude staff. I was then readmitted because my baby was jaundiced and suffered weight loss due to breast feeding and my supply not coming in due to having pre-eclampsia. Nobody advised me of this. Anything could have happened to me or my baby due to this experience. Awful experience.

title: Wonderful care
body: Very well cared for today when feeling quite poorly at the practice. I was seen promptly and looked after so well

author: Farmbirth2021
title: My amazing midwives
body:
After having a long arduous birth with my first born, I was incredibly anxious throughout my second pregnancy about my upcoming labour.  
All throughout my pregnancy, the Dalrymple midwife team were a huge support and encouragement. I was going through alot at the time and they were there, every appointment, reassuring and listening to me.  
This then lead on to the possibility of a home birth due to my reservations about being in hospital again.  
Even though I decided last minute to have a home birth, the team never made me feel to be a hassle and were super organised.  
When my labour finally started, the homebirth team were on call straight away and helped me deliver our beautiful boy in the most amazing birth. I feel so lucky to have been cared for by my amazing midwives. NHS Ayrshire and Arran should be so proud of their midwifery team, they go over and above and I will forever be grateful for the support they gave me.

author: sigmasj89
title: Excellent breastfeeding support
body:
I gave birth to my 3rd child in January 2022 and really wanted to breastfeed him. I had tried and failed to breastfeed my 2 year old daughter in 2020 so this was very emotional for me.  
I contacted the Fife Infant feeding team during the later half of my pregnancy and asked if I could have a chat through my anxieties about attempting to breastfeed.  
During my 36th week of pregnancy, Kelly from the team visited me at home. She spent well over 2 hours talking to me about my anxiety and giving me lots of motivation too. I contacted Kelly 1 day after My son was born and she visited us many many times at home during the first month of his life. I know for a fact we would have given up breastfeeding again at a very early stage had it not been from the excellent care and support Kelly provided me with. She was always at the end of a text or phone call and always offered to visit us at home for hands on help. She was professional but also friendly and I felt so comfortable being able to dicuss anything with her. She and the whole team do a fantastic job and are invaluable to anyone who is breastfeeding. I have continued to stay in touch with Kelly and my son is approaching 6 months and we are still exclusively breastfeeding, which I'm overjoyed at and it's really down to the top class care from Kelly and the infant feeding team.

author: RobertC21
title: Occupational therapy clinical support worker
body: I would like to give a big thanks and appreciation for the hard work and tireless devotion that Stacey gave to me when I was in Queen Victoria Kirkcaldy. Stacey went over and beyond to help me get home and had all equipment in place she is kindness itself and I will never be able to thank her enough

title: Today’s appointment.
body: The doctor listened accurately, was encouraging in his explanations and showed me much kindness and humanity. I am most grateful.

title: Excellent Care and Treatment
body: Having recently completed my Radiotherapy Treatment for prostate cancer I would like to say a big thank you to everyone I I have come into contact with from the original diagnosis right through to the Radiotherapy Department. Everyone has been so professional, kind and caring.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust
